Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶

Root endpoint returning a greeting message.

async main.startup()¶

Function to run on application startup.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶

Create a new contact for the specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to be created.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found.

Returns:

A message confirming the deletion.

Return type:

dict

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

Retrieves a single contact with specified ID for the specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found.

Returns:

The found contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_future_birthdays(user: User, db: Session)¶

Retrieve all contacts with birthdays within next 7 days for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Contacts with birthdays within next 7 days.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.read_contacts(db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session, q: str = None, user=<class 'src.database.models.User'>)¶

Retrieve all contacts for the specific user, optionally filtered by a search query.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • q (str) – The search query. Defaults to None.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

Returns:

List of contacts matching the search query if provided or all contacts of the user, if query is None.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session)¶

Update a specified contact’s details for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • user (User) – The user to whom the contact belongs.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The updated contact details.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrive a user by email from the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to retrive.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session)¶

Update user’s avatar url.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The user’s email.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

Return type:

User

Update token for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update token for.

  • token (str | None) – The refreshed token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

User’s email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message confirming the email.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

User’s authentication. Gets the cridentials provided in body, check if exists and complies with database. Returns acces and refresh token, if succesful.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login cridentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The access token and refresh token.

Rtypr:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh the access token. Provides a new pair of access and refresh tokens for the user.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP authorization credential scontaining the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the new access token, refresh token and token type.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Email confirmation request.

Parameters:

  • body – The email to be confirmed.

  • backgroud_tasks – Background task to run.

  • request (Request) – The base URL of the server.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Tupe body:

RequestEmail

Returns:

A message instructing the user to check their email for confirmation.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new user in database based on data validated by pydantic. Password is hashed and stored in database. An email for email address confirmetion is sent to the newly created users’ email.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the new user to create.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Backgoung task to run.

  • request (Request) – The base url of the server.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user.

Return type:

UserResponse

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

  • current_user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async src.routes.contacts.get_future_birthdays(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve all contacts with birthdays within next 7 days for a specific user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Contacts with birthdays within next 7 days.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(q: str = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve all contacts for the specific user, optionally filtered by a search query.

Parameters:

  • q (str) – The search query. Defaults to None.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

Returns:

List of contacts matching the search query if provided or all contacts of the user, if query is None.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update a specified contact’s details for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The updated contact details.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to whom the contact belongs.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The details of the current user.

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the avatar of the current user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file for the new avatar.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar.

Return type:

UserDb

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Class for authentication and authorization operations.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create an access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode into the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration delta in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

data (dict) – The data to encode into the token.

Returns:

The encoded token.

str

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify if the plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API services Email¶

Send an email for email verification.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The user’s email address.

  • username (str) – The username of the user.

  • host (str) – The host URL for the application.
